contentheadline.headline: Virginia Juvenile and Domestic Relations District Court

contentrichtext.text: A '''Juvenile and Domestic Relations District Court''', in [[Virginia]], handles all cases involving [[juvenile delinquency|juvenile crime]], [[child abuse]] or [[child neglect]], disputes involving custody and visitation, and other family-related matters, as well as cases in which a child or family member is an alleged victim (it can try misdemeanors, but only preliminary hearings in adult felonies). A judge hears all cases. Appeals from J&DR court go to [[Circuit court|Circuit Court]]. The court also has authority to allow minors, under certain circumstances, to seek abortions. It may also emancipate a child. ==References== [http://www.courts.state.va.us/jdrdc/jdrdc.htm The Juvenile and Domestic Relations District Court].
